roleset.name: shut, closure of an entity, not open
roleset.note: CLOSE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'close' based on first 50 or so sentences from big corpus (from close.01-v predicate notes)

CLOSE-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry close.01, OntoNotes sense grouping close.04: the act of shutting something; maps to VN entries other_cos 45.4 and crane-40.3.2. Framed by Claire. (from close.01-n)
CLOSED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. (from closed.01-j)
CLOSING-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from closing.01-n)

example.name: transitive agentive
example.text: Investors-1 want *trace*-1 to close its doors for good.

example.name: ergative, sorta adjectival
example.text: Paris, Brussels, and Milan were closed for a holiday.

example.name: with 'beneficiary'
example.text: Now [the wildlife refuge]-1 has been closed [*-1]to the industry, possibly for years.

example.name: restaurant closure
example.text: From January 2008 until the restaurant's close in July 2009, T.J.'s operated as a collective.

example.name: Shop closing
example.text: All dresses must be picked up 30 minutes prior to the close of the shop each day.

roleset.name: terminate
roleset.note: CLOSE-V NOTES: in this corpus, primarily of stocks (from close.02-v)

example.name: with EXT
example.text: Cray Research closed yesterday at $38 in NYSE composite trading.

example.name: and again
example.text: The FTSE index closed 17.5 points higher at 2160.1

roleset.name: come about, come to completion (as of deals)
roleset.note: CLOSE-V NOTES: Beware of adjectival usages: We need to keep closer track of blue books. Warner Communications Inc is close to an agreement with Bugs Bunny. (from close.03-v)
CLOSING-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from closing.03-n)

example.name: ergative
example.text: Sony's acquisition of Guber/Peters Entertainment closed Monday.

example.name: transitive/agentive
example.text: Armstrong will close the sale of the color unit in late November.
example.arg: the sale of the color unit

roleset.name: become nearer
roleset.note: CLOSE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'close' based on first 50 or so sentences from big corpus (from close.06-v predicate notes)

example.name: here they come!
example.text: Another guy who thinks they're out there and closing fast is Whitley Strieber, whose new novel, ``Majestic'' (Putnam, 317 pages, $18.95), takes a look at a reported 1947 UFO crash near the Roswell Army Air Field in a New Mexico desert.

roleset.name: spatially close, of concrete or abstract things
roleset.note: CLOSE-J NOTES: Roleset based on AMR instances. Closely related to verb-close.06, but different Aktionsart. More than just causation. (from close.01-j)
CLOSER-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from closer.01-j)

role.descr: entity located near something, close thing

example.name: args 1 and 2
example.text: He is close to getting the answer.

example.name: Tight
example.text: These quarters are close!

example.name: Physical, spatial
example.text: Hellems is close to the UMC.

roleset.name: similar, a near approximation,
roleset.note: CLOSE-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. (from close.02-j)

example.name: All args
example.text: A politically biased press operating outside the law must be pretty close to treason .
example.arg: A politically biased press operating outside the law

example.name: Not even close!
example.text: You might find it is n't even close to what you desperately want to think it is .
example.arg: to what you desperately want to think it is

roleset.name: evenly matched, difficult to decide
roleset.note: CLOSE-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. (from close.03-j)

example.name: Vote
example.text: The vote was close in Seattle, but it received 60% approval in Seattle's northern and eastern suburbs.
Even though it was predicted to happen , I still did n't expect MI to be that close given that Romney grew up there and MI seems like a more moderate state to me .
example.arg: given that Romney grew up there and MI seems like a more moderate state to me .

roleset.name: affectionate
roleset.note: CLOSE-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. (from close.04-j)

example.name: Arg 1, close entities in one plural mention
example.text: If their contact has been on and off over the years and they 're not that close anyway then I would put my foot down , it is your special day and he should appreciate that his ex being there makes you uncomfortable ....

example.name: All args
example.text: She is close with her younger biological sister, Silvia, although they sometimes develop natural sibling rivalries.
example.arg: with her younger biological sister, Silvia
although they sometimes develop natural sibling rivalries.

roleset.name: close down: terminate
roleset.note: CLOSE_DOWN-V NOTES: Much the same as the "shut" roleset id="close.05" above.Watch out for "stocks closed down 15% yesterday" (from close.04-v)

example.name: agentive
example.text: John closed down the unprofitable business.

example.name: spam spam spam, glorious spam
example.text: ``Why anyone-2 would want [*-2] to close themselves off (from direct mail), a priori, doesn't make any sense,'' says Michael Bronner of Bronner Slosberg Associates, a Boston directmail firm.

example.name: all args
example.text: But yesterday, as Atlantis rumbled into a patch of clear sky above Florida with storm clouds closing in on it, NASA sought to turn Galileo into a symbol of triumph.

roleset.name: seal from the top
roleset.note: CLOSE_OVER-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on Brown corpus. Comparison to seal. No Vncls (from close.08-v)

roles.note: Note that in this usage, 'over' can not be construed as the head of a PP, because that PP would end up being a location, and in this case, what would follow 'over' is the thing being sealed. (from close.08-v)

example.name: clumsy tourists
example.text: They closed over the mound excavation to keep tourists from falling in.
example.arg: to keep tourists from falling in.

example.name: arg1 as subject
example.text: They had closed over , absolutely , with the sealing of old Izaak 's grave .
example.arg: with the sealing of old Izaak's grave

example.name: ergative
example.text: Their merchandise was never really that good and the store is closing up very soon , but still , I 'm never going to get over that poor old copy of Windows sitting alone , priced where no one would buy it .
